    • Method Detail

      • map

        public static <S,R> ObjectBinding<R> map(ObservableValue<S> source,
                                         Function<? super S,? extends R> function)
        A Binding that holds a value that is determined by the given function applied to the value of the observable source.

        This binding is null safe: When the given observable has a value of null the created binding will also contain null but will not throw a NullPointerException.
        (Hint: if you like to specify another default value look at map(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue, java.util.function.Function, Object)).

        If the given observable`s value is not null the function will be applied to the value and the return value of the function is used as the value of the created binding.

        A common use case for this binding is when you are interested in a property of the object of an observable value. See the following example: 

             class Person {
         private String name;
         ...
         public String getName(){
             return name;
         }
     }

     ObjectProperty personProperty = ...

     ObjectBinding name = ObjectBindings.map(personProperty, Person::getName);
        The "name" binding in the example always contains the name of the Person that the "personProperty" is holding. As you can see this is a good use case for method references introduced by Java 8.

        The binding from the example will not throw a NullPointerException even if the personProperty holds null as value: 

             personProperty.set(null);

     assertThat(name.get()).isNull();
        Your mapping function will only be called when the observable value is not null. This means that you don't need to check for null param in you mapping function.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the generic type of the source observable.
        R - the generic type of the resulting binding.
        Parameters:
        source - the observable value that is the source for this binding.
        function - a function that maps the value of the source to the target binding.
        Returns:
        the created binding.

      • map

        public static <S,R> ObjectBinding<R> map(ObservableValue<S> source,
                                         Function<? super S,? extends R> function,
                                         R defaultValue)
        A null safe binding that holds the return value of the given function when applied to the value of the given observable.

        If the observable has a value of null the given default value (third param) will be used as value for the binding instead.

        The given function will never get null as param so you don't need to check for this.

        See map(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue, java.util.function.Function, Object) for a detailed explanation of the binding.

        Type Parameters:
        S - the generic type of the source observable.
        R - the generic type of the resulting binding.
        Parameters:
        source - the observable value that is the source for this binding.
        function - a function that maps the value of the source to the target binding.
        defaultValue - the default value that is used when the source observable has a value of null.
        Returns:
        the created binding.
